component.text: Match each broadband wireless term to its description.
You have successfully matched each broadband wireless term to its description.

Defines the communications and operations support interface that permits the addition of high-speed data transfer to a traditional cable TV system.
A means of providing high speed connections over pre-existing installed copper wire infrastructure.
A mesh network which blankets an area with radio signals.
Located at the CO, this device combines individual DSL connections from subscribers into one-high capacity link to an ISP.
Combining both fiber-optic and coax cabling together into a hybrid cabling infrastructure.
Located at the headend. This device communicates with CMs located in subscriber homes.
Each of these represent major improvements to the cellular networks for high-speed data capacity.
Sometimes referred to as the DSL modem, it connects the subscriber to the DSL network.
Newer and faster technology for high speed cellular data. Considered to be part of 4G.
